userStories.title: As a user, I want to add tags to my podcast sessions so that I can organize and categorize them
userStories.description: Add a tags input field to the session creation form that allows users to add multiple tags to a session. Tags should be saved in the session metadata.
acceptanceCriteria: Session creation form includes a tags input field below the existing fields
Users can add multiple tags by typing and pressing Enter or comma
Tags are visually represented as removable badges with the purple gradient theme
Tags are saved to session.metadata.tags as a string array
Backend SessionRequest DTO accepts tags in metadata
TypeScript type checking passes (npm run type-check)
Linting passes (npm run lint)
userStories.technicalNotes: Use Tailwind CSS for tag badge styling. Store tags in existing metadata JSONB column. Follow existing VirtualStudio.tsx patterns for form inputs.

userStories.title: As a user, I want to see tags displayed on session cards so that I can quickly identify session topics
userStories.description: Display tags as colored badges on session cards in the HistoryView component
acceptanceCriteria: Session cards in HistoryView display tags below session title
Tags use purple gradient badge styling consistent with design system
Tags are displayed in a flex-wrap layout to handle multiple tags
Maximum of 5 tags shown, with '+N more' indicator if there are additional tags
Clicking a tag does nothing (filtering will be added in US-003)
All quality checks pass
userStories.technicalNotes: Modify HistoryView.tsx and SessionCard component. Use existing badge components if available, or create reusable TagBadge component.

userStories.title: As a user, I want to filter my session history by tag so that I can find related podcasts easily
userStories.description: Add tag filtering capability to the HistoryView component
acceptanceCriteria: HistoryView shows a tag filter dropdown/pills at the top
Clicking a tag in the filter or on a session card filters the list to show only sessions with that tag
Active filter is visually indicated (highlighted tag)
Clear filter button is available when a filter is active
Filter state persists during the session (but not across page reloads)
Filtering works client-side (no backend API changes needed)
All quality checks pass
userStories.technicalNotes: Use React state to manage active filter. Filter sessions client-side using sessions.filter(). Consider using existing HistoryView state management patterns.

technicalContext.specialNotes: Backend runs via VS Code Spring Boot Console

qualityStandards.testing: Manual testing required, unit tests if time permits
qualityStandards.documentation: Update docs if new components are created
